type=""application/ld+json"">{""@context"":""https://schema.org"",""@type"":""FAQPage"",""mainEntity"":[{""@type"":""Question"",""name"":""How are CDs taxed?"",""acceptedAnswer"":{""@type"":""Answer"",""text"":""Generally, you’ll receive a Form 1099-INT each year if you earn more than $10 interest, if there is withholding or if there is a penalty. This will generally be taxed as ordinary income, according to the IRS. For instance, a CD customer with a multi-year CD should receive a 1099-INT from their bank after each year interest is earned if at least $10 of interest was earned during a calendar year.""}},{""@type"":""Question"",""name"":""Are CDs safe?"",""acceptedAnswer"":{""@type"":""Answer"",""text"":""Your CD is safe at either an FDIC-insured bank or a credit union insured by the National Credit Union Share Insurance Fund (NCUSIF), as long as the amount of money in the account is within the established limits and guidelines. Federally insured deposit accounts are safe whether they’re at online banks, brick-and-mortar banks or credit unions since they’re backed by the full faith and credit of the U.S. government. For federally-insured banks and credit unions, the standard insurance limit is $250,000 per depositor or share owner, per insured bank or credit union, for each account ownership category.""}},{""@type"":""Question"",""name"":""Are there fees associated with CDs?"",""acceptedAnswer"":{""@type"":""Answer"",""text"":""CDs generally have an early withdrawal penalty for taking your money out before the CD matures. No-penalty CDs are the exception, though they may also impose a penalty if the funds are withdrawn during the first six or seven days after the account is opened.""}},{""@type"":""Question"",""name"":""What is considered a good CD rate?"",""acceptedAnswer"":{""@type"":""Answer"",""text"":""A good CD rate is one that's higher than the national average – and in the current rate environment it should be outpacing inflation. The consumer price index (CPI) was 2.3 percent for April 2025, so your APY should be higher than this. Knowing for sure that you won’t need your cash for a specific amount of time also typically allows you to earn a higher rate. The bank is willing to pay you more for the certainty that your money will remain in its hands for the designated length of time. For example, the national average APY for 1-year CDs is 2.01 percent as of June 28, 2025, while some top-yielding banks are currently offering one-year CDs with APYs of up to 4.40 percent.""}},{""@type"":""Question"",""name"":""Is an online bank the best choice for a CD?"",""acceptedAnswer"":{""@type"":""Answer"",""text"":""Online banks tend to offer higher APYs than brick-and-mortar banks. These online-only institutions typically have lower overhead costs and are able to pass the savings along to their customers in the form of higher rates. In addition, unlike your bank located on the corner of Main Street, online banks may need a higher APY to get your attention and earn your business.""}},{""@type"":""Question"",""name"":""How long can you leave money in a CD?"",""acceptedAnswer"":{""@type"":""Answer"",""text"":""You can keep your money in a CD and generally let it renew over and over. CDs generally automatically renew. However, unclaimed CDs can be escheated — or transferred from an estate to the government — subject to each state’s laws. To avoid your CD being escheated due to being considered abandoned property, be sure to keep in touch with your bank and keep a valid mailing address on file.""}},{""@type"":""Question"",""name"":""Do CDs have beneficiaries?"",""acceptedAnswer"":{""@type"":""Answer"",""text"":""Banks generally give account holders with CDs the opportunity to name a beneficiary, which is a person who will inherit your savings in the event that you die. While naming a beneficiary for your CD may be the last thing on your mind, experts say it’s an important step to take. If you don’t have a beneficiary designated to receive the funds in your CD, your savings will go through probate, which is the court process for deciding what happens to the property of an individual after their death.""}},{""@type"":""Question"",""name"":""Can you lose money on a CD?"",""acceptedAnswer"":{""@type"":""Answer"",""text"":""As long as your CD is at an FDIC-insured bank or an NCUA-insured credit union and it’s within insurance limits and guidelines, you won’t lose money with a CD. You may lose some of your interest — and potentially some of your principal — by making an early withdrawal, however.""}}]}</script><script type=""application/ld+json"">{""@context"":""https://schema.org"",""@type"":""BreadcrumbList"",""itemListElement"":[{""@type"":""ListItem"",""name"":""Banking"",""item"":{""@type"":""Thing"",""url"":""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/"",""@id"":""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/""},""position"":1},{""@type"":""ListItem"",""name"":""CDs"",""item"":{""@type"":""Thing"",""url"":""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/"",""@id"":""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/""},""position"":2}]}</script><script type=""application/ld+json"">{""@context"":""https://schema.org"",""@type"":""Organization"",""url"":""https://www.bankrate.com/"",""email"":""webmaster@bankrate.com"",""ethicsPolicy"":""https://www.bankrate.com/privacy/"",""foundingDate"":""1976"",""legalName"":""Bank Rate LLC"",""name"":""Bank Rate"",""address"":{""@type"":""PostalAddress"",""addressLocality"":""New York, NY"",""postalCode"":""10017"",""streetAddress"":""750 3rd Ave, 28th Floor""},""foundingLocation"":{""@type"":""Place"",""name"":""New York City, New York, U.S.""},""logo"":{""@type"":""ImageObject"",""url"":""https://www.bankrate.com/v2.828.1/img/logo/bankrate-logo-268x60.jpg""}}</script><meta class=""swiftype"" name=""type"" data-type=""enum"" content=""rates-results"" /><meta class=""swiftype"" name=""title"" data-type=""string"" content=""Best CD Rates Of June 2025 - Up to 4.49% | Bankrate"" /><meta class=""swiftype"" name=""description"" data-type=""text"" content=""Stay informed on today&#039;s best CD rates trending above 4 percent APY. <div class=""SiteNavTopicOverview"">
<p class=""SiteNavTopicOverview-heading"" role=""heading"">Money market accounts</p>
<p class=""SiteNavTopicOverview-copy"">Money market accounts are similar to savings accounts, but offer some checking features as well.</p>
<a href=""/banking/money-market/rates/""
class=""Button Button--primary""data-beam-element-clicked data-type=""button""
data-location=""site-nav""

Credit cards</div>
<div class=""SiteNavSubcategory-tabs"" x-ref=""siteNavTablist"" @keydown.prevent=""keydownSubcategoryTabs"" role=""tablist"" aria-labelledby=""credit-cards-tablist"">

<div class=""SiteNavSearch-container"" :class=""{
        'is-active': isSearchOpen
    }"" x-trap=""isSearchOpen"" data-js-selector=""global-search-filter"" @keydown.esc.capture=""closeSearch()"" x-data=""{
        searchSuggestions: [],
        showSearchAutocomplete: false,
        async fetchSuggestions(query) {
            if (query.length < 2) {
                this.searchSuggestions = [];
                this.showSearchAutocomplete = false;
                return;
            }
            try {
                const response = await fetch(`/search/autocomplete?q=${encodeURIComponent(query)}`);
                if (response.ok) {
                    this.searchSuggestions = await response.json();
                    this.showSearchAutocomplete = this.searchSuggestions.length > 0;
                }
            } catch (error) {
                this.searchSuggestions = [];
                this.showSearchAutocomplete = false;
            }
        }
    }""

>

<div class=""AuthorPreview-bio text-crop-none AuthorPreview-bio--truncated"">
Matthew Goldberg is an award-winning writer who has been in financial services for more than 14 years. He uses his banking experience to help inform readers as they make important personal finance decisions.</div>

<div class=""AuthorPreview-bio text-crop-none AuthorPreview-bio--truncated"">
Marc Wojno is a seasoned and accomplished finance editor and writer with more than two decades of experience editing and writing across a variety of news platforms including newswires, newsletters, magazines and online news sites.</div>

<div class=""pb-2 mb-2 border-b text-gray-900 border-gray-400 font-bold"">How is this page expert verified?</div>
<div class=""text-gray-700 mb-3 text-xs"">
<p class=""mb-4"">At Bankrate, we take the accuracy of our content seriously.</p>
<p class=""mb-4"">&ldquo;Expert verified&rdquo; means that our Financial Review Board thoroughly evaluated the article for accuracy and clarity. The Review Board comprises a panel of financial experts whose objective is to ensure that our content is always objective and balanced.</p>
<p class=""mb-0"">Their reviews hold us accountable for publishing high-quality and trustworthy content.

<div class=""rateTableEditorialIntegrity-content text-blue-50 text-xs py-2 px-4 max-w-5xl rounded-lg text-white"">
<span>
At Bankrate we strive to help you make smarter financial decisions. Though our partners compensate us from links on this page, we maintain <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/editorial-guidelines/"" target=""_blank"" rel=""noopener"">editorial integrity</a>, and partners don't influence our product evaluations.<span>
Here's
<a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/advertising-disclosure/"" target=""_blank"" rel=""noopener"">how we make money</a>
and here is our
<a class=""Link"" data-target=""editorial_integrity_advertiser-disclosure-modal"">advertiser disclosure</a>.
</span>

Advertiser Disclosure
</h3>
The listings that appear on this page are from companies from which this website receives compensation, which may impact how, where and in what order products appear. This table does not include all companies or all available products. Bankrate does not endorse or recommend any companies.

<p class=""mb-0"">
<span id=""intro-text-shortened"">
Opening a certificate of deposit (CD) allows you to lock in an attractive fixed rate and earn higher returns compared to traditional savings accounts, while providing guaranteed growth for a set period of time. Currently, the best CD rates still earn above 4 percent APY. The top rate tracked by Bankrate is offered by Rising Bank for a six-month CD. Before opening a certificate of deposit, be sure to read expert advice and tips below to ensure a financially safe decision.</span>
<button class=""text-blue-200 Link Link--standalone bg-transparent hover:border-blue-200"" :class=""{
                    'hidden': expanded,
                }"" type=""button"" :aria-expanded=""expanded ? true : false"" aria-controls=""rateTableReadMoreContent"" x-on:click=""expanded = !expanded"" x-show=""!expanded"">
Read more
</button>
</p>

                'flex': expanded,
                'hidden': !expanded
            }"">

<p><strong>Bankrate's picks for top CD rates today</strong></p></div>

<ul class=""unordered-list flex flex-col gap-4 pl-6 marker:text-blue-800"" data-show-all=""false"">

class=""FormLabel"" for=""productTypeDropdown"">Product type</label></div><div class=""w-auto flex flex-row self-center""><div id=""productTypeDropdown"" class=""w-full z-5 mr-2 bg-white min-h-[50px] border border-gray-500 rounded""><div class=""wrt-Collapsible""><p class=""wrt-Collapsible-header text-crop-none""><button type=""button"" data-testid=""collapsible-combined-filters-label"" class=""wrt-Collapsible-trigger border-b border-gray-600"" id=""collapsible-combined-filters-label"" aria-expanded=""false"" aria-controls=""collapsible-combined-filters""><span class=""pl-4 pr-2 py-2 "">CDs</span><svg width=""7"" height=""12"" focusable=""false"" aria-hidden=""true"" style=""transform:rotate(90deg)"" class=""wrt-Collapsible-chevron mr-2"" title=""Open""><path d=""M1.4 12L0 10.5 4.2 6 0 1.5 1.4 0 7 6l-5.6 6z""></path></svg></button></p></div></div><div class=""pt-4""><div class=""wrt-Tooltip""><div class=""wrt-Tooltip-trigger"" aria-label=""Account type information"" aria-describedby=""tooltip-«R19e5im»"" tabindex=""0"" role=""button""><svg width=""17"" height=""16"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" color=""#0157FF""><path d=""M8.5 0a8 8 0 1 1 0 16 8 8 0 0 1 0-16zm0 1a7 7 0 1 0 0 14 7 7 0 0 0 0-14zm1 6v5h-2V7h2zm-1-3a1 1 0 0 1 1 1.012.994.994 0 0 1-1 .988c-.549 0-1-.451-1-.988 0-.56.451-1.012 1-1.012z"" fill=""currentColor"" fill-rule=""evenodd""></path></svg></div><div class=""wrt-Tooltip-content Tooltip-content Tooltip-content--belowTrigger Tooltip-content--anchorRight wrt-Tooltip--large"" id=""tooltip-«R19e5im»"" role=""tooltip""><div class=""Tooltip-body""><div class=""Tooltip-arrow""></div><p class=""text-crop-none"">The following accounts can be found at most banks and credit unions. They&#x27;re federally insured for up to $250,000 and offer a safe place to put your money while earning interest.</p><div class=""text-base mb-1 text-gray-900 font-bold"">Certificate of Deposit (CD)</div><p class=""text-crop-none"">CDs are best for individuals looking for a guaranteed rate of return that&#x27;s typically higher than a savings account. In exchange for a higher rate, funds are tied up for a set period of time and early withdrawal penalties may apply.</p><div class=""text-base mb-1 text-gray-900 font-bold"">Checking account</div><p class=""text-crop-none"">Checking accounts are best for individuals who want to keep their money safe while still having easy, day-to-day access to their funds. ATM and other transactional fees may apply.</p><div class=""text-base mb-1 text-gray-900 font-bold"">Savings / Money Market Accounts (MMA)</div><p class=""text-crop-none"">Savings and MMAs are good options for individuals looking to save for shorter-term goals. They&#x27;re a safe way to separate your savings from everyday cash, but may require larger minimum balances and have transfer limitations.</p></div></div></div></div></div></div><button type=""button"" class=""Button--primary h-[49px] mt-6"">Update results</button></div></div></div><div class=""wrt-RateTable-main wrt-RateTable-uninitialized""><div <div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why First Internet Bank of Indiana?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">First Internet Bank of Indiana was one of the first online banks, established in 1999. It offers eight terms of CDs, all paying competitive APYs. The terms range from three months to five years, which gives you lots of options for short- and long-term savings. All CDs require a minimum of $1,000 to open; that’s standard, though you can find some banks that have a lower minimum deposit requirement. The bank has steep early withdrawal penalties though. For example, you&#039;ll be charged 360 days of interest as a penalty for early withdrawals on CDs with terms of 24 months or more.</p>
</div>

<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">

                        <p class='type-heading-four text-base mb-4'>Bankrate CD rating = 4.4/5</p>

<div>6 months - 3 years</div>

<div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why Limelight Bank?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">Limelight Bank is an online bank based in Utah that offers its CDs nationwide. It has four CD terms: six months, one year, 18 months and three years. The rates are competitive, and this mix of terms gives customers some flexibility to find a CD that matches their short-term saving needs, but you&#039;ll need to look elsewhere for longer-term investments. All of Limelight’s CDs require at least $1,000 to open. The bank doesn’t offer any specialty CDs, such as bump-up or no-penalty CDs.</p>
</div>

<span class=""WealthHistoricalRateTrends-cdDetailsContainer--text"">How do we get this data?</span>
<div id=""tb33d6f53-91cb-48a1-ba18-07b6af1e26fc"" class=""hidden"">
<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">
Bankrate independently tracks hundreds of APYs and product details for banking institutions nationwide. We retain the historical data of every rate we track in our database. If there are any gaps where we weren’t actively tracking a rate at the time, the graph will reflect the missing data.</div>

<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">

                        <p class='type-heading-four text-base mb-4'>Bankrate CD rating = 4/5</p>
                        <p>Bankrate scores are objectively determined by our editorial team. Annual percentage yields (APYs) and minimum deposits are some of the things that make up Bankrate’s score.</p>
                    </div>
</div>
<div class=""inline-block cursor-pointer ml-1 "">

<div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why Popular Direct?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">Popular Direct is an online bank and a subsidiary of Popular Inc., a more than 130-year-old financial services company. It offers CDs in eight terms, ranging from three months to five years. With a $10,000 minimum deposit to open, these CDs are geared toward serious savers. Popular Direct doesn’t offer specialty CDs, such as bump-up or no-penalty CDs, though it does offer a savings account with a competitive rate.</p>
</div>

<span class=""WealthHistoricalRateTrends-cdDetailsContainer--text"">How do we get this data?</span>
<div id=""t598bb20c-8b5d-4aff-b6d2-7b8335e0a773"" class=""hidden"">
<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">
Bankrate independently tracks hundreds of APYs and product details for banking institutions nationwide. We retain the historical data of every rate we track in our database. If there are any gaps where we weren’t actively tracking a rate at the time, the graph will reflect the missing data.</div>

<span class=""WealthHistoricalRateTrends-cdDetailsContainer--text"">How do we get this data?</span>
<div id=""t598bb20c-8b5d-4aff-b6d2-7b8335e0a773"" class=""hidden"">
<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">
Bankrate independently tracks hundreds of APYs and product details for banking institutions nationwide. We retain the historical data of every rate we track in our database. If there are any gaps where we weren’t actively tracking a rate at the time, the graph will reflect the missing data.</div>

<div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why Rising Bank?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">Rising Bank is the online division of Midwest BankCentre, a St. Louis, Missouri community bank. When it comes to CDs, it offers terms between six months and three years, and the shorter terms earn highly competitive APYs. The bank also offers bump-up CDs that allow you to raise the rate if rates increase during the term, at which time you can also add funds to the account.</p>
</div>

<span class=""WealthHistoricalRateTrends-cdDetailsContainer--text"">How do we get this data?</span>
<div id=""tf6f38c9e-d3bb-4a2b-a4f0-b9e88bb05cc7"" class=""hidden"">
<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">
Bankrate independently tracks hundreds of APYs and product details for banking institutions nationwide. We retain the historical data of every rate we track in our database. If there are any gaps where we weren’t actively tracking a rate at the time, the graph will reflect the missing data.</div>

<div class=""flex items-center"">
<span class=""WealthHistoricalRateTrends-cdDetailsContainer--text"">How do we get this data?</span>
<div id=""tf6f38c9e-d3bb-4a2b-a4f0-b9e88bb05cc7"" class=""hidden"">
<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">
Bankrate independently tracks hundreds of APYs and product details for banking institutions nationwide. We retain the historical data of every rate we track in our database. If there are any gaps where we weren’t actively tracking a rate at the time, the graph will reflect the missing data.</div>
</div>
<div class=""inline-block cursor-pointer ml-1 "">
<div x-data data-tippy-maxWidth=""none"" data-template=""tf6f38c9e-d3bb-4a2b-a4f0-b9e88bb05cc7""

<div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why Bask Bank?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">Bask Bank is the online division of Texas Capital Bank and similarly to its parent bank, offers only short-term CD terms. These terms range from three months to two years and all offer competitive yields. You’ll need at least $1,000 to open a CD at Bask Bank. Those looking for a longer-term CD will have to look elsewhere. You’ll also need to look at other banks if you&#039;re interested in specialty CDs, such as no-penalty CDs, because Bask doesn&#039;t offer any.</p>
</div>

                        <p class='type-heading-four text-base mb-4'>Bankrate CD rating = 4.6/5</p>
                        <p>Bankrate scores are objectively determined by our editorial team. Annual percentage yields (APYs) and minimum deposits are some of the things that make up Bankrate’s score.</p>

<div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why First National Bank of America?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">First National Bank of America is a Michigan-based bank that offers its CDs online nationwide. And its CD rates are competitive across many terms, especially on a few of its shortest terms and its longest. You can open a CD here with a $1,000 minimum deposit, and you have your pick of terms from three months all the way up to ten years. You can open any of these CDs online, but if you want a hard copy of the CD too, you can request one from the bank. The bank also offers one other online account: a savings account that earns a decent yield (though you can find higher elsewhere).</p>
</div>

<span class=""WealthHistoricalRateTrends-cdDetailsContainer--text"">How do we get this data?</span>
<div id=""t038123a5-6c5e-4e38-8a95-61f975419cfd"" class=""hidden"">
<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">
Bankrate independently tracks hundreds of APYs and product details for banking institutions nationwide. We retain the historical data of every rate we track in our database. If there are any gaps where we weren’t actively tracking a rate at the time, the graph will reflect the missing data.</div>

<div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why Salem Five Direct?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">Salem Five Direct, established in 1995 as an online division of Salem Five Bank (which was founded in 1855), offers Special CDs ranging from nine months to five years. At $10,000, the minimum balance to open one of these CDs is higher than what many other online banks require. The bank&#039;s Special CD offerings are more competitive for shorter-term CDs than longer-term ones.</p>
</div>
<ul class=""Accordion w-full mb-0"">
        <li
    x-id=""['panel-pros-and-cons', 'heading-pros-and-cons']""

    <button
        class=""Accordion-titleContainer px-3 py-2 sm:px-6 group""

        :data-outcome=""expanded ? 'open_accordion' : 'close_accordion'""

        <h4 class=""Accordion-title mr-2 md:flex-1 my-0"">
    Pros and cons
    </h4>
    

        <span
            class=""Accordion-icon Icon Icon--sm icon-base-blue-600""

            <svg class=""Icon-glyph"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Down Icon</title><path d=""M12 17.152c-.33 0-.675-.131-.94-.378L3.384 9.09a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 0-1.86c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0L12 13.977l6.755-6.747c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0 .51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.694 7.684a1.295 1.295 0 0 1-.94.378H12Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg>        </span>

<span style=""max-width: 24px; width: 100%;"">

<span class=""type-heading-four text-base"">Pros</span>
</div>
<div class=""ml-2"">
<ul><li>The shorter-term CDs earn high yields.</li></ul></div>
</div>
<div class=""wysiwyg md:w-1/2"">

<span class=""WealthHistoricalRateTrends-cdDetailsContainer--text"">How do we get this data?</span>
<div id=""td93adb47-1668-45ef-94a1-749e9a02655d"" class=""hidden"">
<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">
Bankrate independently tracks hundreds of APYs and product details for banking institutions nationwide. We retain the historical data of every rate we track in our database. If there are any gaps where we weren’t actively tracking a rate at the time, the graph will reflect the missing data.</div>
</div>

<div class=""flex flex-col items-start md:flex-row md:items-center"">
<h3 class=""heading-4 font-bold mb-2 md:mb-0 mr-2"">CIBC Bank USA</h3>

<div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why Texas Capital Bank?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">Texas Capital Bank is based in Texas and while some of its accounts are reserved for Texas residents, it offers its CDs nationwide, and it has a few CD terms with highly competitive APYs. You can choose from six CD terms at Texas Capital, ranging from one month to two years. The minimum deposit to open a CD is $1,000.</p>
</div>

<span class=""WealthHistoricalRateTrends-cdDetailsContainer--text"">How do we get this data?</span>
<div id=""t652276ca-2a54-4788-bfe6-00d4dbff007a"" class=""hidden"">
<div class=""w-72"" style=""max-width: calc(100vw - 4rem)"">
Bankrate independently tracks hundreds of APYs and product details for banking institutions nationwide. We retain the historical data of every rate we track in our database. If there are any gaps where we weren’t actively tracking a rate at the time, the graph will reflect the missing data.</div>

<div class=""py-6 px-4 bg-gray-50 rounded-lg md:my-6 mb-6 md:mb-4"">
<h4 class=""text-base mb-4"">Why Synchrony Bank?</h4>
<p class=""mb-0"">Synchrony Bank is an online-only bank that offers many regular CDs ranging from three months to five years. Synchrony stands out because there is no minimum deposit required to open one of its CDs. Synchrony also has a no-penalty CD, a bump-up CD and IRA CDs. The bank also offers a savings account, but no checking.</p>
</div>

<!-- End Below the Fold Layout Section -->

<div
id=""recent-news-on-cd-rates"" class=""below-the-fold-layout__section overflow-x-hidden bg-white px-4 py-6 rounded-lg z-5 sm:px-6 sm:py-8 sm:mb-8 sm:max-lg:col-start-2 sm:max-lg:col-span-1 lg:col-start-1 lg:row-start-(--row) has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:mb-0 has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:rounded-b-none [.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:rounded-t-none lg:[.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:pt-0""style=""--row: 2"">
<div
data-cy="""" class=""Headline w-full"">
<h2 class=""heading-2"">
    Recent news on CD rates
    </h2>
    
</div>
<div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p><a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/federal-reserve/fomc-meeting-recap-june-2025/"">At its June 18 meeting</a>, the Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) decided to hold its benchmark federal funds rate steady for the fourth straight meeting. Previously, the Fed cut rates by a total of 100 basis points — or one percentage point — throughout its final three meetings in 2024. The federal funds rate continues to rest at a range of 4.25-4.5 percent.</p>
<p>Though CD rates peaked in the fourth quarter of 2023 for the top one-year and five-year CDs in the current rate cycle, competitive CD rates are still higher than the national average CD rates. What’s more, high-yielding CD rates continue to outpace the rate of inflation.</p>
<p>The Consumer Price Index (CPI) rose 2.4 percent on an annual basis for May. This means savers still have the opportunity to open a CD that's outpacing inflation and will likely outpace long-term inflation expectations. With that said, nobody really knows whether inflation will stay around this level.</p>
<p>When looking for a CD, seek a competitive interest rate, a term length that works for you and have your money at a Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. (FDIC) bank or National Credit Union Administration (NCUA) credit union for deposit insurance coverage. Also, familiarize yourself with early withdrawal penalties to avoid potentially losing money if you need your funds for an unexpected expense.</p></div>
<div class=""vertical-spacer pt-12 pt-(--pt) w-full"" style=""content: ''; --pt: 3rem""></div>
<div class=""infogram-embed"" data-id=""4bd524e8-d860-4e27-8cd4-c364522d8e58"" data-type=""interactive"" data-title=""CD rate changes throughout 2024 and 2025""></div>
<div class=""vertical-spacer pt-12 pt-(--pt) w-full"" style=""content: ''; --pt: 3rem""></div>
<div class=""SupplementaryLink"">
Learn more:
<a class="" "" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/cd-rate-forecast/""
target=""_blank""data-beam-element-clicked data-type=""link""
data-location=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/cd-rates/""
data-name=""Learn more link""
data-position=""middle""
data-text=""CD rate forecast""
data-outcome=""send to page""
>
CD rate forecast</a>
</div>
<div class=""vertical-spacer pt-12 pt-(--pt) w-full"" style=""content: ''; --pt: 3rem""></div>
<div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<h3>National average interest rates for CDs</h3>
<p>Researching <a href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/current-cd-interest-rates/"">average interest rates</a> provides insight into the <a href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/cd-rate-forecast/"">CD rate environment</a> and can help in finding a CD with a yield that's much higher than average. Here are the current average rates as of Jun 28, according to Bankrate's most recent survey of institutions:</p></div>
<div x-data=""table({
    containerId: 'cec6450f-5220-4a74-b47a-7469b030fc33',
    tableId: 'table-cec6450f-5220-4a74-b47a-7469b030fc33',
    buttonId: 'button-cec6450f-5220-4a74-b47a-7469b030fc33',
    rowsToShow: 0,
    enableTracking: '',
    trackingHtmlId: '',
    trackingLocation: '',
})"">

5 year</td>
<td data-col=""2"" class=""text-right"">
1.72%</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<table id=""header-fixed-cec6450f-5220-4a74-b47a-7469b030fc33"" class=""Table table-content header-fixed hidden""></table>
</div>
<div "
"class=""mt-4 mb-8"">
</div>
</div>
<ul class=""Accordion w-full"" data-cy=""accordion-a5ad711e-5bf1-4472-8115-16d34441b599"">
        <li
    x-id=""['panel-span-classtext-how-bankrate-calculates-the-national-averagespan', 'heading-span-classtext-how-bankrate-calculates-the-national-averagespan']""
    x-data=""{
        expanded: 0,
        disableMobileHover: 0,
    }""
    class=""Accordion-item"">
    <button
        class=""Accordion-titleContainer px-3 py-2 sm:px-6 group sm:py-4""

                x-on:click=""expanded = !expanded""
        data-beam-element-clicked-no-delay id=""""
data-type=""accordion""
data-location=""""
data-name=""
how bankrate calculates the national average
""
data-position=""1""
data-text=""
How Bankrate calculates the national average
""
data-outcome=""""
data-variant=""default""
        :data-outcome=""expanded ? 'open_accordion' : 'close_accordion'""
        :class=""{ 'no-hover': (typeof isMobile !== 'undefined' && isMobile) && disableMobileHover }"">
        
        <h3 class=""Accordion-title mr-2 md:flex-1 my-0"">
    <span class=""text"">
How Bankrate calculates the national average</span>
    </h3>
    

        <span
            class=""Accordion-icon Icon Icon--sm icon-base-blue-600""
            aria-hidden=""true"">
            <svg class=""Icon-glyph"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Down Icon</title><path d=""M12 17.152c-.33 0-.675-.131-.94-.378L3.384 9.09a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 0-1.86c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0L12 13.977l6.755-6.747c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0 .51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.694 7.684a1.295 1.295 0 0 1-.94.378H12Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg>        </span>
    </button>
    <div
        class=""Accordion-contentWrapper""
        :id=""$id('panel-span-classtext-how-bankrate-calculates-the-national-averagespan')""
        :labelledBy=""$id('heading-span-classtext-how-bankrate-calculates-the-national-averagespan')""
        x-show=""expanded""
        x-collapse
        role=""region""
         style=""height: 0px; overflow: hidden; display: none;"" >
        <div
            class=""Accordion-content text-gray-700 px-3 pb-4 sm:px-6 sm:pb-6"">
            <div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p>Bankrate made enhancements to our national averages database on April 14, 2025, including ones that retroactively impact previous weeks’ listings in our table. Previous enhancements were also made in January 2025. Up to 1,200 banks and credit unions are surveyed weekly to generate the national averages. Among these institutions are those that are broadly available and offer high yields, as well as some of the nation’s largest banks.</p></div>
        </div>
    </div>

<h3 class=""type-heading-three w-full mb-4"">
What our industry experts are saying</h3>
<div class=""AskTheExperts-panel flex-col @3xl:flex-row -m-2"" role=""list"">
<div class=""AskTheExperts-panelItem p-2"" role=""listitem"">
<button id=""AskTheExperts-tab-1"" class=""AskTheExperts-panelAuthor rounded bg-white p-4"" x-on:click=""author_id_active = 'b9c710f1-8a7e-432b-94bb-de54817e7e40'"" role=""button"" aria-label=""Author name Taylor Kovar"">

<p class=""font-bold m-0 ml-4"" aria-hidden=""true"">Mark Hamrick</p>
</button>
</div>
<div class=""AskTheExperts-panelItem p-2"" role=""listitem"">
<button id=""AskTheExperts-tab-3"" class=""AskTheExperts-panelAuthor rounded bg-white p-4"" x-on:click=""author_id_active = '4ffa0ce4-fd06-4fed-b81b-88780be66547'"" role=""button"" aria-label=""Author name Christopher Stroup"">
<img srcset=""https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1536x2048/3742cafbf7/christopher-stroup-cfp.jpg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=48&amp;height=48&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=1.5 1.5x, https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1536x2048/3742cafbf7/christopher-stroup-cfp.jpg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=48&amp;height=48&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=2 2x, https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1536x2048/3742cafbf7/christopher-stroup-cfp.jpg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=48&amp;height=48&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=3 3x"" src=""https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1536x2048/3742cafbf7/christopher-stroup-cfp.jpg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=48&amp;height=48&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart"" loading=""lazy"" class=""AuthorAvatar AuthorAvatar--md  shrink-0"" alt="""">
<p class=""font-bold m-0 ml-4"" aria-hidden=""true"">Christopher Stroup</p>
</button>
</div>
</div>
<hr class=""w-full border-gray-200 border mx-0 my-2"">
<div class=""AskTheExperts-details"" role=""tabpanel"">
<div x-show=""author_id_active == 'b9c710f1-8a7e-432b-94bb-de54817e7e40'"" aria-labelledby=""AskTheExperts-tab-1"" role=""tabpanel"" style="""">
<div class=""AskTheExperts-detailsItem"">
<span class=""AskTheExperts-detailsAuthor no-underline cursor-default"">
<img srcset=""https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/938x1412/d5ec43f2c7/taylor-kovar-cfp.jpeg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=1.5 1.5x, https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/938x1412/d5ec43f2c7/taylor-kovar-cfp.jpeg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=2 2x, https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/938x1412/d5ec43f2c7/taylor-kovar-cfp.jpeg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=3 3x"" src=""https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/938x1412/d5ec43f2c7/taylor-kovar-cfp.jpeg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart"" loading=""lazy"" class=""AuthorAvatar AuthorAvatar--lg  shrink-0"" alt="""">
<div class=""ml-6"">
<p class=""heading-4 border-0 m-0 mb-1"">Taylor Kovar</p>
<p class=""text-gray-700 m-0"">CFP, founder and CEO of 11 Financial</p>
</div>
</span>
<div class=""w-full mt-4 border-gray-200 border rounded bg-white p-4"">
<p class=""text-sm text-gray-dark m-0"">
CD rates in 2025 are being shaped by a lot of moving parts. With tariffs back in the headlines and some uncertainty around what the Fed might do next, it’s definitely a time to pay attention. The Fed’s holding steady for now, but there’s still talk of possible cuts, and banks are staying competitive in the meantime. If locking in a CD is something you&#039;re considering, this could be a smart window. Rates may not stay this attractive if things shift later in the year.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div x-show=""author_id_active == 'e8797b3f-4bf5-4420-941b-7c8ad0b18aa1'"" aria-labelledby=""AskTheExperts-tab-2"" role=""tabpanel"" style=""display: none;"">
<div class=""AskTheExperts-detailsItem"">
<a class=""AskTheExperts-detailsAuthor no-underline"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/authors/mark-hamrick/"">
<img srcset=""https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1096x731/63f9dc32df/mark-hamrick-expert-stylistic.png?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=1.5 1.5x, https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1096x731/63f9dc32df/mark-hamrick-expert-stylistic.png?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=2 2x, https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1096x731/63f9dc32df/mark-hamrick-expert-stylistic.png?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=3 3x"" src=""https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1096x731/63f9dc32df/mark-hamrick-expert-stylistic.png?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart"" loading=""lazy"" class=""AuthorAvatar AuthorAvatar--lg  shrink-0"" alt="""">
<div class=""ml-6"">
<p class=""heading-4 Link text-blue-600 border-0 m-0 mb-1"">Mark Hamrick</p>
<p class=""text-gray-700 m-0"">Bankrate senior economic analyst</p>
</div>
</a>
<div class=""w-full mt-4 border-gray-200 border rounded bg-white p-4"">
<p class=""text-sm text-gray-dark m-0"">
If I asked you whether you’d settle for something average, or something better, what would you opt for? You’d go for something better, right? The same holds true here. Don’t settle for the average rate, go for the highest yield, which can be two times or more than average. With larger sums and over time, the difference on your return can be more than might meet the eye.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div x-show=""author_id_active == '4ffa0ce4-fd06-4fed-b81b-88780be66547'"" aria-labelledby=""AskTheExperts-tab-3"" role=""tabpanel"" style=""display: none;"">
<div class=""AskTheExperts-detailsItem"">
<span class=""AskTheExperts-detailsAuthor no-underline cursor-default"">
<img srcset=""https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1536x2048/3742cafbf7/christopher-stroup-cfp.jpg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=1.5 1.5x, https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1536x2048/3742cafbf7/christopher-stroup-cfp.jpg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=2 2x, https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1536x2048/3742cafbf7/christopher-stroup-cfp.jpg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart&dpr=3 3x"" src=""https://www.bankrate.com/f/102997/1536x2048/3742cafbf7/christopher-stroup-cfp.jpg?auto=webp&amp;quality=85&amp;width=64&amp;height=64&amp;fit=cover&amp;enable=upscale&amp;crop=1:1,smart"" loading=""lazy"" class=""AuthorAvatar AuthorAvatar--lg  shrink-0"" alt="""">
<div class=""ml-6"">
<p class=""heading-4 border-0 m-0 mb-1"">Christopher Stroup</p>
<p class=""text-gray-700 m-0"">CFP, founder and president of Silicon Beach Financial</p>
</div>
</span>
<div class=""w-full mt-4 border-gray-200 border rounded bg-white p-4"">
<p class=""text-sm text-gray-dark m-0"">
With the Federal Reserve signaling only two modest rate cuts this year — down from the four previously projected — the window to lock in higher CD yields remains open but may not stay that way for long. If you already hold a CD, your rate is fixed and insulated from future changes until maturity. For those considering a new CD, now is an opportune moment to secure a competitive yield, especially as the Fed adopts a cautious approach amid ongoing inflation and economic uncertainties.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div></div>
<!-- End Below the Fold Layout Section -->

<div
id=""current-promotional-cd-rates"" class=""below-the-fold-layout__section overflow-x-hidden bg-white px-4 py-6 rounded-lg z-5 sm:px-6 sm:py-8 sm:mb-8 sm:max-lg:col-start-2 sm:max-lg:col-span-1 lg:col-start-1 lg:row-start-(--row) has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:mb-0 has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:rounded-b-none [.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:rounded-t-none lg:[.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:pt-0""style=""--row: 3"">
<div
data-cy="""" class=""Headline w-full"">
<h2 class=""heading-2"">
    Current promotional CD rates
    </h2>
    
</div>
<div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p>Some banks have promotional CD rates, even some of the <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/biggest-banks-in-america/"">largest banks</a>. There might be certain restrictions on these CDs. For instance, you might have to bring money from outside the bank to be eligible for this APY. Promotional CDs may renew at a different term and at a different APY. (That APY is likely to not be known when you purchase a promotional CD.)</p></div>

<!-- End Below the Fold Layout Section -->

<div
id=""compare-top-cd-rates-today-by-term"" class=""below-the-fold-layout__section overflow-x-hidden bg-white px-4 py-6 rounded-lg z-5 sm:px-6 sm:py-8 sm:mb-8 sm:max-lg:col-start-2 sm:max-lg:col-span-1 lg:col-start-1 lg:row-start-(--row) has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:mb-0 has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:rounded-b-none [.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:rounded-t-none lg:[.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:pt-0""style=""--row: 4"">
<div
data-cy="""" class=""Headline w-full"">
<h2 class=""heading-2"">
    Compare top CD rates today by term
    </h2>
    
</div>
<div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p>When you open a CD, selecting a term is an important step. The term is the length of time that the money stays stashed in the account. For example, opening a CD with a one-year term means you&rsquo;re making a commitment to the bank that you&rsquo;ll keep your money in the account for one year.</p>
<p>Here&rsquo;s where you&rsquo;ll find some of the top-yielding CDs by term.</p></div>
<div id=""tabs-v3-64465e83-0c43-4259-a334-9d8500200b8a"" class=""TabsV3"" x-data=""{
        selectedId: null,
        init() {
            // Set the first available tab on the page on page load.
            this.$nextTick(() => this.select(this.$id('tab', 1)))
        },
        select(id) {
            this.selectedId = id
        },
        isSelected(id) {
            return this.selectedId === id
        },
        whichChild(el, parent) {
            return Array.from(parent.children).indexOf(el) + 1
        }
    }"" x-id=""['tab']"">
<div class=""sm:gutter"">
<div class=""wrapper"" style="""">
<div class=""TabsV3-select FormControl"">
<select aria-label=""Select your option"" class=""FormSelect normal-case"" x-model=""selectedId""
@change=""() => $el.dataset.text = $el.options[$el.selectedIndex].text"">
<option :value=""$id('tab', 1)"">
3-month rates</option>
<option :value=""$id('tab', 2)"">
6-month rates﻿</option>

<a class="" "" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/what-is-a-cd/""
target=""""data-beam-element-clicked data-type=""link""
data-location=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/cd-rates/""

data-position=""middle""

data-outcome=""send to page""
>
What is a CD?</a>
</div>
<div class=""vertical-spacer pt-16 pt-(--pt) w-full"" style=""content: ''; --pt: 4rem""></div>
<div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<h3>Types of CDs</h3>
<p>Banks and credit unions offer <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/what-type-of-cd-is-best/"">a wide range of CDs</a> to fit different financial needs. Take some time to consider which type of CD is best for you.</p></div>
<div id=""tabs-v3-b2ecfb1b-737a-46c0-8f2c-8d235e2047e2"" class=""TabsV3"" x-data=""{
        selectedId: null,
        init() {
            // Set the first available tab on the page on page load.
            this.$nextTick(() => this.select(this.$id('tab', 1)))
        },
        select(id) {
            this.selectedId = id
        },
        isSelected(id) {
            return this.selectedId === id
        },
        whichChild(el, parent) {
            return Array.from(parent.children).indexOf(el) + 1
        }
    }"" x-id=""['tab']"">
<div class=""sm:gutter"">
<div class=""wrapper"" style="""">
<div class=""TabsV3-select FormControl"">
<select aria-label=""Select your option"" class=""FormSelect normal-case"" x-model=""selectedId""
@change=""() => $el.dataset.text = $el.options[$el.selectedIndex].text"">
<option :value=""$id('tab', 1)"">
Traditional CDs</option>
<option :value=""$id('tab', 2)"">
No-penalty CDs</option>
<option :value=""$id('tab', 3)"">
Bump-up CDs</option>
</select>
<svg class=""FormSelect-arrow Icon Icon--xs"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Down Icon</title><path d=""M12 17.152c-.33 0-.675-.131-.94-.378L3.384 9.09a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 0-1.86c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0L12 13.977l6.755-6.747c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0 .51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.694 7.684a1.295 1.295 0 0 1-.94.378H12Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg></div>
<ul class=""TabsV3-nav full-width hidden md:flex"" x-ref=""tablist"" @keydown.right.prevent.stop=""$focus.wrap().next()"" @keydown.home.prevent.stop=""$focus.first()"" @keydown.page-up.prevent.stop=""$focus.first()"" @keydown.left.prevent.stop=""$focus.wrap().prev()"" @keydown.end.prevent.stop=""$focus.last()"" @keydown.page-down.prevent.stop=""$focus.last()"" role=""tablist"">
<li class=""TabsV3-item pb-0"" role=""presentation"">
<button :id=""$id('tab', whichChild($el.parentElement, $refs.tablist))"" @click=""select($el.id);"" @mousedown.prevent @focus=""select($el.id)"" type=""button"" :tabindex=""isSelected($el.id) ? 0 : -1"" :aria-selected=""isSelected($el.id)"" :class=""isSelected($el.id) ? 'is-active' : ''"" role=""tab"" class=""TabsV3-button""
>
Traditional CDs</button>
</li>
<li class=""TabsV3-item pb-0"" role=""presentation"">
<button :id=""$id('tab', whichChild($el.parentElement, $refs.tablist))"" @click=""select($el.id);"" @mousedown.prevent @focus=""select($el.id)"" type=""button"" :tabindex=""isSelected($el.id) ? 0 : -1"" :aria-selected=""isSelected($el.id)"" :class=""isSelected($el.id) ? 'is-active' : ''"" role=""tab"" class=""TabsV3-button""
>
No-penalty CDs</button>
</li>
<li class=""TabsV3-item pb-0"" role=""presentation"">
<button :id=""$id('tab', whichChild($el.parentElement, $refs.tablist))"" @click=""select($el.id);"" @mousedown.prevent @focus=""select($el.id)"" type=""button"" :tabindex=""isSelected($el.id) ? 0 : -1"" :aria-selected=""isSelected($el.id)"" :class=""isSelected($el.id) ? 'is-active' : ''"" role=""tab"" class=""TabsV3-button""
>
Bump-up CDs</button>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
</div>
<div class=""TabsV3-content mt-5 TabsV3-content-noscript sm:gutter"" x-cloak>
<noscript>
<style>
.TabsV3-content-noscript {
                    display: block !important;
                }
</style>
</noscript>
<div class=""wrapper"">
<div x-show=""isSelected($id('tab', whichChild($el, $el.parentElement)))"" :aria-labelledby=""$id('tab', whichChild($el, $el.parentElement))"" role=""tabpanel"" class=""TabsV3-tab"" style="""">
<div class=""vertical-spacer pt-6 pt-(--pt) w-full"" style=""content: ''; --pt: 1.5rem""></div>
<div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p>Traditional CDs are the most common type of CD, and they earn a fixed APY for the entire term. These CDs usually don’t allow you to add more funds after your opening deposit, and they also tend to have strict early withdrawal penalties.</p>
<p>If you withdraw from a CD before it matures, the penalty is usually equal to the amount of interest earned during a certain period of time. For instance, a bank may impose a penalty of 90 days of simple interest on a one-year CD if you withdraw from that CD before the year is up.</p>
<p><strong>When this CD makes sense:</strong> Traditional CDs are a good choice if you know exactly when you’ll need the money, and there’s no chance of needing it before the term is up. They’re often good for CD ladders or other CD investing strategies in which timing is important.</p></div>
</div>
<div x-show=""isSelected($id('tab', whichChild($el, $el.parentElement)))"" :aria-labelledby=""$id('tab', whichChild($el, $el.parentElement))"" role=""tabpanel"" class=""TabsV3-tab"" style="""">
<div class=""vertical-spacer pt-6 pt-(--pt) w-full"" style=""content: ''; --pt: 1.5rem""></div>
<div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p>Most CDs charge you a penalty for accessing the funds before the term is up. However, some banks offer <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/best-no-penalty-cd-rates/"">no-penalty CDs</a> — also known as liquid CDs — which allow you to withdraw the money early without being charged a penalty.&nbsp;</p>
<p>A bank may require that you wait at least some time after opening a no-penalty CD — generally around seven days — before you’re able to withdraw from the CD, and some banks don’t allow for partial withdrawals. No-penalty CD rates tend to be lower than regular CD rates, but they can be better than some <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/savings/best-high-yield-interests-savings-accounts/"">high-yield savings account</a> or money market account rates.</p>
<p><strong>When this CD makes sense:</strong> Consider a no-penalty CD if you don’t plan to withdraw the money before the CD matures, but you want to keep some flexibility in case you need access to the funds. As a result, you’re willing to give up a little return for added liquidity.</p></div>
</div>
<div x-show=""isSelected($id('tab', whichChild($el, $el.parentElement)))"" :aria-labelledby=""$id('tab', whichChild($el, $el.parentElement))"" role=""tabpanel"" class=""TabsV3-tab"" style="""">
<div class=""vertical-spacer pt-6 pt-(--pt) w-full"" style=""content: ''; --pt: 1.5rem""></div>
<div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p><a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/bump-up-cd/"">Bump-up CDs</a> enable you to request an increase in your rate during the CD term under certain conditions. Banks that offer this CD usually allow just one bump-up per term. Fo"
"r example, you may open a three-year CD at a given rate, and the bank offers an additional half-point rate increase when you’re one year into the term. With a bump-up CD, you can request a rate increase for the remainder of the term. Like no-penalty CDs, bump-up CDs often pay lower rates than traditional CDs.</p>
<p><strong>When this CD makes sense:</strong> A bump-up CD could be a good option if rates are expected to rise significantly during the term of the CD. Otherwise, you’re likely accepting a lower rate for limited potential upside.</p></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div
data-campaign=""br-main-rt-cds-spl-first"" data-ad-id=""fcfaaeaf-005b-4ae9-8c39-b5064b6ea5f9""class=""myFinance-widget""></div></div>
<!-- End Below the Fold Layout Section -->

<div
id=""who-should-get-a-cd"" class=""below-the-fold-layout__section overflow-x-hidden bg-white px-4 py-6 rounded-lg z-5 sm:px-6 sm:py-8 sm:mb-8 sm:max-lg:col-start-2 sm:max-lg:col-span-1 lg:col-start-1 lg:row-start-(--row) has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:mb-0 has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:rounded-b-none [.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:rounded-t-none lg:[.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:pt-0""style=""--row: 6"">
<div
data-cy="""" class=""Headline w-full"">
<h2 class=""heading-2"">
    Who should get a CD?
    </h2>
    
</div>
<div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p>A CD is useful when you want to earn a consistent, fixed yield on your lump sum of cash over the term of your savings account, especially if interest rates are declining. It also encourages you to be disciplined in leaving your money untouched as it earns interest because a CD is a time deposit account and imposes an early withdrawal penalty if you withdraw your funds before the CD matures.</p>
<p>A good time to open a CD is when you have a lump sum of money that you want to sock away for a specific period of time in the hopes of consistently growing interest. Also, it&rsquo;s worth opening a CD when you know you have a specific timeframe in mind when you think you&rsquo;ll need this money. A six-month CD, for example, could be a good place to put your money aside for an insurance premium that&rsquo;s due in eight months.</p></div>
<div class=""SupplementaryLink"">
Learn more:
<a class="" "" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/cd-ladder-guide/""
target=""""data-beam-element-clicked data-type=""link""
data-location=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/cd-rates/""
data-name=""Learn more link""
data-position=""middle""
data-text=""How to build a CD ladder""
data-outcome=""send to page""
>
How to build a CD ladder</a>
</div></div>
<!-- End Below the Fold Layout Section -->

<div
id=""pros-and-cons-of-cds"" class=""below-the-fold-layout__section overflow-x-hidden bg-white px-4 py-6 rounded-lg z-5 sm:px-6 sm:py-8 sm:mb-8 sm:max-lg:col-start-2 sm:max-lg:col-span-1 lg:col-start-1 lg:row-start-(--row) has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:mb-0 has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:rounded-b-none [.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:rounded-t-none lg:[.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:pt-0""style=""--row: 7"">
<div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<h2 id=""what-to-consider-when-choosing-a-cd"">Pros and cons of CDs</h2>
<p>Before you choose a CD, weigh the pros and cons to ensure you're making the right investment choice for your financial situation.</p></div>
<div class=""pros-and-cons "">
<div class=""flex gap-4 sm:gap-6 flex-col sm:flex-row"">
<div class=""sm:w-1/2"">
<div
data-cy="""" class=""Headline w-full"">
<h3 class=""text-base font-bold border-b pb-3 mb-5"">
    Pros
    </h3>
    
</div>
<ul class=""List"">
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""Icon-glyph h7 w-6 shrink-0 text-green-600"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Checkmark Icon</title><path d=""M8.982 18.477a.976.976 0 0 1-.658-.266l-5.056-5.055a.926.926 0 0 1 0-1.305.927.927 0 0 1 1.305 0L8.97 16.25 19.427 5.792a.926.926 0 0 1 1.305 0 .926.926 0 0 1 0 1.304L9.628 18.2a.906.906 0 0 1-.658.265l.012.012Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">Some CDs earn a higher APY than money market accounts or savings accounts.</p>
</div>
</li>
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""Icon-glyph h7 w-6 shrink-0 text-green-600"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Checkmark Icon</title><path d=""M8.982 18.477a.976.976 0 0 1-.658-.266l-5.056-5.055a.926.926 0 0 1 0-1.305.927.927 0 0 1 1.305 0L8.97 16.25 19.427 5.792a.926.926 0 0 1 1.305 0 .926.926 0 0 1 0 1.304L9.628 18.2a.906.906 0 0 1-.658.265l.012.012Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">CDs are a good place to store funds that you don’t want to be able to dip into too easily.</p>
</div>
</li>
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""Icon-glyph h7 w-6 shrink-0 text-green-600"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Checkmark Icon</title><path d=""M8.982 18.477a.976.976 0 0 1-.658-.266l-5.056-5.055a.926.926 0 0 1 0-1.305.927.927 0 0 1 1.305 0L8.97 16.25 19.427 5.792a.926.926 0 0 1 1.305 0 .926.926 0 0 1 0 1.304L9.628 18.2a.906.906 0 0 1-.658.265l.012.012Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">CDs can help you separate money for financial goals or future expenses.</p>
</div>
</li>
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""Icon-glyph h7 w-6 shrink-0 text-green-600"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Checkmark Icon</title><path d=""M8.982 18.477a.976.976 0 0 1-.658-.266l-5.056-5.055a.926.926 0 0 1 0-1.305.927.927 0 0 1 1.305 0L8.97 16.25 19.427 5.792a.926.926 0 0 1 1.305 0 .926.926 0 0 1 0 1.304L9.628 18.2a.906.906 0 0 1-.658.265l.012.012Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">Deposit insurance covers accounts at FDIC banks and NCUA credit unions up to at least $250,000.</p>
</div>
</li>
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""Icon-glyph h7 w-6 shrink-0 text-green-600"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Checkmark Icon</title><path d=""M8.982 18.477a.976.976 0 0 1-.658-.266l-5.056-5.055a.926.926 0 0 1 0-1.305.927.927 0 0 1 1.305 0L8.97 16.25 19.427 5.792a.926.926 0 0 1 1.305 0 .926.926 0 0 1 0 1.304L9.628 18.2a.906.906 0 0 1-.658.265l.012.012Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">A CD can diversify your savings plan with a guaranteed rate.</p>
</div>
</li>
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""Icon-glyph h7 w-6 shrink-0 text-green-600"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Checkmark Icon</title><path d=""M8.982 18.477a.976.976 0 0 1-.658-.266l-5.056-5.055a.926.926 0 0 1 0-1.305.927.927 0 0 1 1.305 0L8.97 16.25 19.427 5.792a.926.926 0 0 1 1.305 0 .926.926 0 0 1 0 1.304L9.628 18.2a.906.906 0 0 1-.658.265l.012.012Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">Your principal remains intact if you keep your money in a CD for the full term.</p>
</div>
</li>
</ul>
</div>
<div class=""sm:w-1/2"">
<div
data-cy="""" class=""Headline w-full"">
<h3 class=""text-base font-bold border-b pb-3 mb-5"">
    Cons
    </h3>
    
</div>
<ul class=""List"">
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""h7 w-6 text-red-600 shrink-0"" width=""24"" height=""24"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""none"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"">
<path fill-rule=""evenodd"" clip-rule=""evenodd"" d=""M5.62252 7.17879L7.41279 5.38672L18.7265 16.7004L16.8 18.5995L5.62252 7.17879Z"" fill=""#D71919""/>
<path fill-rule=""evenodd"" clip-rule=""evenodd"" d=""M16.9344 5.50932L18.7265 7.29959L7.41281 18.6133L5.51375 16.6868L16.9344 5.50932Z"" fill=""#D71919""/>
</svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">CDs tie up your money for a potentially long period of time.</p>
</div>
</li>
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""h7 w-6 text-red-600 shrink-0"" width=""24"" height=""24"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""none"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"">
<path fill-rule=""evenodd"" clip-rule=""evenodd"" d=""M5.62252 7.17879L7.41279 5.38672L18.7265 16.7004L16.8 18.5995L5.62252 7.17879Z"" fill=""#D71919""/>
<path fill-rule=""evenodd"" clip-rule=""evenodd"" d=""M16.9344 5.50932L18.7265 7.29959L7.41281 18.6133L5.51375 16.6868L16.9344 5.50932Z"" fill=""#D71919""/>
</svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">Many CDs have early withdrawal penalties.</p>
</div>
</li>
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""h7 w-6 text-red-600 shrink-0"" width=""24"" height=""24"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""none"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"">
<path fill-rule=""evenodd"" clip-rule=""evenodd"" d=""M5.62252 7.17879L7.41279 5.38672L18.7265 16.7004L16.8 18.5995L5.62252 7.17879Z"" fill=""#D71919""/>
<path fill-rule=""evenodd"" clip-rule=""evenodd"" d=""M16.9344 5.50932L18.7265 7.29959L7.41281 18.6133L5.51375 16.6868L16.9344 5.50932Z"" fill=""#D71919""/>
</svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">Money committed to a CD could end up earning a lackluster yield if rates rise substantially. The early withdrawal penalty may negate any benefit of switching to a higher-yielding CD, however.</p>
</div>
</li>
<li class=""mb-5"">
<div class=""flex items-start gap-4"">
<svg class=""h7 w-6 text-red-600 shrink-0"" width=""24"" height=""24"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""none"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"">
<path fill-rule=""evenodd"" clip-rule=""evenodd"" d=""M5.62252 7.17879L7.41279 5.38672L18.7265 16.7004L16.8 18.5995L5.62252 7.17879Z"" fill=""#D71919""/>
<path fill-rule=""evenodd"" clip-rule=""evenodd"" d=""M16.9344 5.50932L18.7265 7.29959L7.41281 18.6133L5.51375 16.6868L16.9344 5.50932Z"" fill=""#D71919""/>
</svg><p class=""text-base text-gray-700 m-0"">You could potentially earn better rates of return in the stock market or by investing in other securities, but you'll be opening up your money to more risk.</p>
</div>
</li>
</ul>

<div
id=""alternatives-to-cds"" class=""below-the-fold-layout__section overflow-x-hidden bg-white px-4 py-6 rounded-lg z-5 sm:px-6 sm:py-8 sm:mb-8 sm:max-lg:col-start-2 sm:max-lg:col-span-1 lg:col-start-1 lg:row-start-(--row) has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:mb-0 has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:rounded-b-none [.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:rounded-t-none lg:[.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:pt-0""style=""--row: 8"">
<div
data-cy="""" class=""Headline w-full"">
<h2 class=""heading-2"">
    Alternatives to CDs
    </h2>
    
</div>
<div class=""ProductTileList"">
<a class=""ProductTile"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/savings/best-high-yield-interests-savings-accounts/"" >
<div class=""ProductTile-wrapper"">
<div class=""ProductTile-content"">
<p class=""ProductTile-header"">High-yield savings account</p>
<p class=""ProductTile-supportText"">This account tends to earn a yield currently of about seven times higher than the national average. At online-only banks, these accounts often won’t have monthly service fees or minimum balance requirements.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class=""ProductTile-buttonContainer"">
<div class=""ProductTile-button"">
<svg class=""Icon Icon--xs text-white"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Right Icon</title><path d=""M8.168 21a1.39 1.39 0 0 1-.938-.379c-.51-.51-.51-1.35 0-1.86l6.744-6.75L7.23 5.242c-.51-.51-.51-1.35 0-1.86a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 1.859 0l7.681 7.689c.51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.681 7.69A1.29 1.29 0 0 1 8.15 21h.017Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg></div>
</div>
</a>
<a class=""ProductTile"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/money-market/rates/"" >
<div class=""ProductTile-wrapper"">
<div class=""ProductTile-content"">
<p class=""ProductTile-header"">Money market account</p>
<p class=""ProductTile-supportText"">This is an interest-bearing account available at both banks and credit unions which is similar to a savings account but also offers some checking account features.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class=""ProductTile-buttonContainer"">
<div class=""ProductTile-button"">
<svg class=""Icon Icon--xs text-white"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Right Icon</title><path d=""M8.168 21a1.39 1.39 0 0 1-.938-.379c-.51-.51-.51-1.35 0-1.86l6.744-6.75L7.23 5.242c-.51-.51-.51-1.35 0-1.86a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 1.859 0l7.681 7.689c.51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.681 7.69A1.29 1.29 0 0 1 8.15 21h.017Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg></div>
</div>
</a>
<a class=""ProductTile"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/investing/best-short-term-bond-funds/"" >
<div class=""ProductTile-wrapper"">
<div class=""ProductTile-content"">
<p class=""ProductTile-header"">Short-term bond funds</p>
<p class=""ProductTile-supportText"">These funds, be they exchange-traded funds (ETFs) or mutual funds, typically invest in government and corporate bonds. Short-term bond funds typically have durations of one to three and a half years, according to Fidelity.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class=""ProductTile-buttonContainer"">
<div class=""ProductTile-button"">
<svg class=""Icon Icon--xs text-white"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Right Icon</title><path d=""M8.168 21a1.39 1.39 0 0 1-.938-.379c-.51-.51-.51-1.35 0-1.86l6.744-6.75L7.23 5.242c-.51-.51-.51-1.35 0-1.86a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 1.859 0l7.681 7.689c.51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.681 7.69A1.29 1.29 0 0 1 8.15 21h.017Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg></div>
</div>
</a>
<a class=""ProductTile"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/savings/rates/"" >
<div class=""ProductTile-wrapper"">
<div class=""ProductTile-content"">
<p class=""ProductTile-header"">Index funds</p>
<p class=""ProductTile-supportText"">These funds are based on a preset basket of stocks, or index. They promise ownership of a wide variety of stocks, greater diversification and lower risk – usually all at a low cost.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class=""ProductTile-buttonContainer"">
<div class=""ProductTile-button"">
<svg class=""Icon Icon--xs text-white"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Right Icon</title><path d=""M8.168 21a1.39 1.39 0 0 1-.938-.379c-.51-.51-.51-1.35 0-1.86l6.744-6.75L7.23 5.242c-.51-.51-.51-1.35 0-1.86a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 1.859 0l7.681 7.689c.51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.681 7.69A1.29 1.29 0 0 1 8.15 21h.017Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg></div>
</div>
</a></div>
<div
data-campaign=""br-main-rt-cds-spl-second"" data-ad-id=""3ca4eb00-894c-4c9b-81a0-a383788687b9""class=""myFinance-widget""></div></div>
<!-- End Below the Fold Layout Section -->

<div
id=""cd-faqs"" class=""below-the-fold-layout__section overflow-x-hidden bg-white px-4 py-6 rounded-lg z-5 sm:px-6 sm:py-8 sm:mb-8 sm:max-lg:col-start-2 sm:max-lg:col-span-1 lg:col-start-1 lg:row-start-(--row) has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:mb-0 has-[+.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside]:rounded-b-none [.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:rounded-t-none lg:[.below-the-fold-layout\_\_aside+&]:pt-0""style=""--row: 9"">
<div
data-cy="""" class=""Headline w-full"">
<h2 class=""heading-2"">
    CD FAQs
    </h2>
    
</div>
<ul class=""Accordion w-full"" data-cy=""accordion-064b7d87-ed87-4ca5-bdf4-49f349944f4d"">

        :aria-controls=""$id('panel-how-are-cds-taxed')""
        :aria-expanded=""expanded ? true : false""
                x-on:click=""expanded = !expanded""
        data-beam-element-clicked-no-delay id=""""

how are cds taxed?

data-position=""1""

data-outcome=""""

        :data-outcome=""expanded ? 'open_accordion' : 'close_accordion'""
        :class=""{ 'no-hover': (typeof isMobile !== 'undefined' && isMobile) && disableMobileHover }"">
        
        <h3 class=""Accordion-title mr-2 md:flex-1 my-0"">
    <span class=""text"">
How are CDs taxed?</span>
    </h3>
    

        <span
            class=""Accordion-icon Icon Icon--sm icon-base-blue-600""
            aria-hidden=""true"">
            <svg class=""Icon-glyph"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Down Icon</title><path d=""M12 17.152c-.33 0-.675-.131-.94-.378L3.384 9.09a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 0-1.86c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0L12 13.977l6.755-6.747c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0 .51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.694 7.684a1.295 1.295 0 0 1-.94.378H12Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg>        </span>
    </button>
    <div
        class=""Accordion-contentWrapper""
        :id=""$id('panel-how-are-cds-taxed')""
        :labelledBy=""$id('heading-how-are-cds-taxed')""
        x-show=""expanded""
        x-collapse
        role=""region""
         style=""height: 0px; overflow: hidden; display: none;"" >
        <div
            class=""Accordion-content text-gray-700 px-3 pb-4 sm:px-6 sm:pb-6"">
            <div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p>Generally, you’ll receive a Form 1099-INT each year <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/paying-tax-on-cd-interest/"">if you earn more than $10 interest</a>, if there is withholding or if there is a penalty. This will generally be taxed as ordinary income, according to the IRS.</p>
<p>For instance, a CD customer with a multi-year CD should receive a 1099-INT from their bank after each year interest is earned if at least $10 of interest was earned during a calendar year.</p></div>
        </div>
    </div>

This will generally be taxed as ordinary income, according to the IRS.</p>
<p>For instance, a CD customer with a multi-year CD should receive a 1099-INT from their bank after each year interest is earned if at least $10 of interest was earned during a calendar year.</p></div>

        </div>
    </noscript>

    <span class=""text"">
Are CDs safe?</span>
    </h3>
    

        <span
            class=""Accordion-icon Icon Icon--sm icon-base-blue-600""
            aria-hidden=""true"">
            <svg class=""Icon-glyph"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Down Icon</title><path d=""M12 17.152c-.33 0-.675-.131-.94-.378L3.384 9.09a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 0-1.86c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0L12 13.977l6.755-6.747c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0 .51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.694 7.684a1.295 1.295 0 0 1-.94.378H12Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg>        </span>
    </button>
    <div
        class=""Accordion-contentWrapper""
        :id=""$id('panel-are-cds-safe')""
        :labelledBy=""$id('heading-are-cds-safe')""
        x-show=""expanded""
        x-collapse
        role=""region""
         style=""height: 0px; overflow: hidden; display: none;"" >
        <div
            class=""Accordion-content text-gray-700 px-3 pb-4 sm:px-6 sm:pb-6"">
            <div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p>Your <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/are-cds-safe/"">CD is safe</a> at either an <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/fdic-insurance/"">FDIC-insured bank</a> or a credit union insured by the National Credit Union Share Insurance Fund (<a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/credit-unions/ncua-how-your-savings-at-credit-unions-are-insured-by-the-government/"">NCUSIF), </a>as long as the amount of money in the account is within the established limits and guidelines. Federally insured deposit accounts are safe whether they’re at online banks, brick-and-mortar banks or credit unions since they’re backed by the full faith and credit of the U.S. government.</p>
<p>For <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/faq-bank-safety-and-deposit-insurance/"">federally-insured banks</a> and credit unions, the standard insurance limit is $250,000 per depositor or share owner, per insured bank or credit union, for each account ownership category.</p></div>
        </div>
    </div>

    
    <noscript>
        <div
            class=""Accordion-contentWrapper""
            :id=""$id('no-js-panel-are-cds-safe')""
            :labelledBy=""$id('heading-are-cds-safe')""

            <div class=""Accordion-content text-gray-700 px-3 pb-4 sm:px-6 sm:pb-6"">
                <div class=""wysiwyg block w-full"">
<p>Your <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/cds/are-cds-safe/"">CD is safe</a> at either an <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/fdic-insurance/"">FDIC-insured bank</a> or a credit union insured by the National Credit Union Share Insurance Fund (<a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/credit-unions/ncua-how-your-savings-at-credit-unions-are-insured-by-the-government/"">NCUSIF), </a>as long as the amount of money in the account is within the established limits and guidelines. Federally insured deposit accounts are safe whether they’re at online banks, brick-and-mortar banks or credit unions since they’re backed by the full faith and credit of the U.S. government.</p>
<p>For <a class=""Link"" href=""https://www.bankrate.com/banking/faq-bank-safety-and-deposit-insurance/"">federally-insured banks</a> and credit unions, the standard insurance limit is $250,000 per depositor or share owner, per insured bank or credit union, for each account ownership category.</p></div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </noscript>

What is considered a good CD rate?</span>
    </h3>
    

        <span
            class=""Accordion-icon Icon Icon--sm icon-base-blue-600""
            aria-hidden=""true"">
            <svg class=""Icon-glyph"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Down Icon</title><path d=""M12 17.152c-.33 0-.675-.131-.94-.378L3.384 9.09a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 0-1.86c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0L12 13.977l6.755-6.747c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0 .51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.694 7.684a1.295 1.295 0 0 1-.94.378H12Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg>        </span>
    </button>
    <div
        class=""Accordion-contentWrapper""
        :id=""$id('panel-good-cd-rate')""
        :labelledBy=""$id('heading-good-cd-rate')""
        x-show=""expanded""
        x-collapse
        role=""region""
         style=""height: 0px; overflow: hidden; display: none;"" >
        <div
            class=""Accordion-content text-gray-700 px-3 pb-4 sm:px-6 sm:pb-6"">
            <div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p>A good CD rate is one that's higher than the national average – and in the current rate environment it should be outpacing inflation. The consumer price index (CPI) was 2.3 percent for April 2025, so your APY should be higher than this.</p>
<p>Knowing for sure that you won’t need your cash for a specific amount of time also typically allows you to earn a higher rate. The bank is willing to pay you more for the certainty that your money will remain in its hands for the designated length of time.</p>
<p>For example, the national average APY for 1-year CDs is 2.01 percent as of June 28, 2025, while some top-yielding banks are currently offering one-year CDs with APYs of up to 4.40 percent.</p></div>
        </div>
    </div>

                <div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p>A good CD rate is one that's higher than the national average – and in the current rate environment it should be outpacing inflation. The consumer price index (CPI) was 2.3 percent for April 2025, so your APY should be higher than this.</p>
<p>Knowing for sure that you won’t need your cash for a specific amount of time also typically allows you to earn a higher rate. The bank is willing to pay you more for the certainty that your money will remain in its hands for the designated length of time.</p>
<p>For example, the national average APY for 1-year CDs is 2.01 percent as of June 28, 2025, while some top-yielding banks are currently offering one-year CDs with APYs of up to 4.40 percent.</p></div>

            <div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p>Online banks tend to offer higher APYs than brick-and-mortar banks. These online-only institutions typically have lower overhead costs and are able to pass the savings along to their customers in the form of higher rates. In addition, unlike your bank located on the corner of Main Street, online banks may need a higher APY to get your attention and earn your business.</p></div>

    </button>
    <div
        class=""Accordion-contentWrapper""
        :id=""$id('panel-how-long')""
        :labelledBy=""$id('heading-how-long')""
        x-show=""expanded""
        x-collapse
        role=""region""
         style=""height: 0px; overflow: hidden; display: none;"" >
        <div
            class=""Accordion-content text-gray-700 px-3 pb-4 sm:px-6 sm:pb-6"">
            <div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p>You can keep your money in a CD and generally let it renew over and over. CDs generally automatically renew. However, unclaimed CDs can be escheated — or transferred from an estate to the government — subject to each state’s laws. To avoid your CD being escheated due to being considered abandoned property, be sure to keep in touch with your bank and keep a valid mailing address on file.</p></div>
        </div>
    </div>

    
    <noscript>

                <div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p>You can keep your money in a CD and generally let it renew over and over. CDs generally automatically renew. However, unclaimed CDs can be escheated — or transferred from an estate to the government — subject to each state’s laws. To avoid your CD being escheated due to being considered abandoned property, be sure to keep in touch with your bank and keep a valid mailing address on file.</p></div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </noscript>
    </li>

            class=""Accordion-icon Icon Icon--sm icon-base-blue-600""
            aria-hidden=""true"">
            <svg class=""Icon-glyph"" viewBox=""0 0 24 24"" fill=""currentColor"" xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" focusable=""false""><title>Caret Down Icon</title><path d=""M12 17.152c-.33 0-.675-.131-.94-.378L3.384 9.09a1.32 1.32 0 0 1 0-1.86c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0L12 13.977l6.755-6.747c.51-.51 1.351-.51 1.862 0 .51.51.51 1.35 0 1.86l-7.694 7.684a1.295 1.295 0 0 1-.94.378H12Z"" class=""icon-base""/></svg>        </span>
    </button>
    <div
        class=""Accordion-contentWrapper""
        :id=""$id('panel-beneficiaries')""
        :labelledBy=""$id('heading-beneficiaries')""
        x-show=""expanded""
        x-collapse
        role=""region""
         style=""height: 0px; overflow: hidden; display: none;"" >
        <div
            class=""Accordion-content text-gray-700 px-3 pb-4 sm:px-6 sm:pb-6"">
            <div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p>Banks generally give account holders with CDs the opportunity to name a beneficiary, which is a person who will inherit your savings in the event that you die. While naming a beneficiary for your CD may be the last thing on your mind, experts say it’s an important step to take.</p>
<p>If you don’t have a beneficiary designated to receive the funds in your CD, your savings will go through probate, which is the court process for deciding what happens to the property of an individual after their death.</p></div>
        </div>
    </div>

    
    <noscript>
        <div
            class=""Accordion-contentWrapper""
            :id=""$id('no-js-panel-beneficiaries')""
            :labelledBy=""$id('heading-beneficiaries')""
            role=""region"">
            <div class=""Accordion-content text-gray-700 px-3 pb-4 sm:px-6 sm:pb-6"">
                <div class=""wysiwyg inline"">
<p>Banks generally give account holders with CDs the opportunity to name a beneficiary, which is a person who will inherit your savings in the event that you die. While naming a beneficiary for your CD may be the last thing on your mind, experts say it’s an important step to take.</p>
<p>If you don’t have a beneficiary designated to receive the funds in your CD, your savings will go through probate, which is the court process for deciding what happens to the property of an individual after their death.</p></div>
            </div>
        </div>
    </noscript>
    </li>
    
<li
    x-id=""['panel-lose-money', 'heading-lose-money']""
    x-data=""{
        expanded: 0,
        disableMobileHover: 0,
    }""
    class=""Accordion-item"">
    <button
        class=""Accordion-titleContainer px-3 py-2 sm:px-6 group sm:py-4""

                x-on:click=""expanded = !expanded""
        data-beam-element-clicked-no-delay id=""""
data-type=""accordion""

can you lose money on a cd?
""
